newsitem.title: ZIMBABWE: Zimbabwean stocks maintain upward trend.
newsitem.headline: Zimbabwean stocks maintain upward trend.

text.p: Zimbabwean industrial shares maintained their march ahead on Wednesday as refunds from an issue by a local merchant bank continued to flow into the market, finding a home mainly in blue-chip counters, brokers said.
The main 57-share industrial index rose 48.75 points to close at 10,457.46, lifted largely by agriculture investor Chemco's 350-cent leap to 4,750 and publisher Zimpapers's 100-cent jump to 5,600.

"There's about Z$400 million in refunds coming back into the market from the NMB (National Merchant Bank) issue. The attention has mainly been on the blue-chips and we expect the market to continue firm for the foreseeable future," one broker said.

Also among the day's winners, pharmaceutical group Caps rose 160 cents to 1,550, farming implement-maker Zimplow added 50 cents to 750 as did Alloys to 550 while electronics company Apex put on 25 cents to 300.
Minings were subdued on the back of a lower bullion price with most counters trading unchanged while gold finvestor Falcon surged 300 cents to 1,600.
The secondary mining index put on 3.79 points to 1,023.82.
